titleStmt.title: Letter of credence for the Resident of Great Britain to Russia, George Mackenzie
titleStmt.author: Queen
of
Great
Britain
Anne

head.title: 26 April / 7 May 1714. – Letter of credence for the Resident of Great Britain to Russia, George Mackenzie{{p1338}}

note.bibl: NA Kew, Russia, no. SP 91-8, f. 5-5v. English copy

div.p: Anne{{p0668}} by the Grace of God Queen of Great Britain, France and Ireland Defender of Faith &c. to the most Hugh, most Potent, most Illustrious Prince, Our most Dear Brother the great Lord Czar, & great Duke Peter Alexiowits{{p0174}} of all great little& white Russia, Sole Monarch of Muscovia, Kiovia, Ulodomiria, Novogardia, Czar of Cazan, Czar of Astracan, Czar of Siberia, Lord of Pscovia, and great Duke of Smolensko, Tueria, Ugoria, Perpica [sic !] Viaskia, Bolgaria, &other Places, Lord &Great Duke of Novogardia, Tzernivovia, Resania, Rostovia, Jaroslavia, Belosoria, Udoria, Obdoria, Condinia, and Emperor of all the Northern Coasts, Lord of Iberia, Cartalinia & Gruzinia, Czar of Caberdinia, Circassia, and the Duke of the Mountains and of many other Dominions & Countrys East and West & North from Father to Grand Father, Heir Successor, Lord & Kuler Sendeth Greetings and wisheth all Happiness & Prosperity. Most Potent & our most Dear Loving Brother, having thought it necessary to dispatch a Person to your Imperial Majesty, who may assure you of Our Resolution not only to maintain the Friendship & good Correspond[en]ce which for so many ages have continued

between Our Pdecessors, but also to improve & cultivate the Same. We have for this Purpose made choice of Our Trusty & Welbeloved George Mackenzie{{p1338}} Esq[ui]r[e] as a Person of whose Prudence & ability We have had good Experience and have appointed him to be Our Resident, who will acquaint Your Imperial Majesty with the great Esteem & Value We have for your Person and Friendship. We desire Your Imperial Majesty will give Our said Resident free access & entire Credit in what he shall say, and especially when he shall assure You of Our Friendship for Your Imperial Majesty ; and so We recommend you to the Protection of almighty God. Given at Our Court{{o0002}} at St. James’s the 26.th Day of April 1714. In the Thirteenth Year of Our Reign.
